This small restaurant down the street from the Picasso museum serves amazing food and drink.  We started with sangria and tomato bread.  I usually do not like red wine but the taste of this was delicious.  We ordered three tapas and a dessert which was plenty of food for two people Appetizer: ham croquettes- smooth mashed potato rolls with ham that are quickly fried.  Crispy outside and creamy inside.  We had one each but they were so delicious I could have had another 2nd: grilled leeks- small tender pieces of leek with olive paste and drizzle of olive oil.  These were unbelievable.  The taste was like nothing we have ever tasted.   3rd: iberio ribs in honey.  Think extremely tender short ribs that melt in your mouth with a sweet glaze.  These were by far my favorite until we got to dessert. Dessert: Cremoso de chocolate con pan.  Smooth creamy chocolate with olive oil and sea salt.  Spread the chocolate on bread toasts and eat.  By far the most delicious dessert we have ever eaten and we love dessert!It is fun to watch the owner, Daniel, work his magic in the open kitchen. This was truly the best tapas restaurant that we have ever been to
